channel.title: Networking on Benevides' Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Networking on Benevides' Blog

item.title: Tcp Ip
item.description: :ID: 3bdcfa3b-8fb6-4c4f-97d9-9abaf4aa4a8b Unlike the Osi Model, but “Application”, “Presentation” and “Session” are folded in a single layer. Transmission Control Protocol / Internet Protocol

item.title: Osi Model
item.description: :ID: e1a39e7c-50a7-4ad8-84f0-dfb7a8864e8b The Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model is a reference tool for understanding data communications between any two networked systems. It divides the communications processes into seven layers. Each layer both performs specific functions to support the layers above it and offers services to the layers below it. Physical Layer Data Link MAC Addressing Flow control Error control: Error detection, followed by correction and/or re-transmition. Line discipline Unit of measure: Frames Network IP Addressing Unit of measure: Packets Transport Responsible for providing and managing end-to-end transmission of messages between two end nodes.

item.title: Iscsi
item.description: :ID: 3a7a03ae-8932-4d86-ae45-aa84ff1f325a :ROAM_ALIASES: iSCSI Definition iSCSI an acronym for Internet Small Computer Systems Interface, an Internet Protocol (IP)-based storage networking standard for linking data storage facilities. It provides block-level access to storage devices by carrying Scsi commands over a TCP/IP network.
